title: The Best Split Pea Soup
shortDescription: A classic split pea soup, perfected over time. Truly, it is a failure-proof recipe.
description: Learn how to make a Michelin restaurant-quality vegan split pea soup. With a hearty texture and tons of flavor, this recipe will surely please your family and guests.
alt: A picture of a green split peas
ingredients: 3/4 cup dry, Dried Green Split Peas
directions: Start by heating the pot at medium heat, while dicing the onion and garlic. Add them to the pot, stirring now and then until the onion and garlic are sticking to the bottom and you see golden-brown bits.
Add about 1/2 cup of broth to deglaze.

Add the carrots and potatoes, stirring constantly for about 5 minutes. Add the split peas, bay leaves, oregano, black pepper, and salt. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot (leaving a about 1/4 inch opening) and simmer for about 55 minutes.
Serve hot with a few splashes of lime or lemon juice. Drizzle with a little olive oil if you like.
